It needs a wireless data connection to acquire GPS assistance data (EPO) that may cause extra network fee. Are you sure to turn on GPS assistance?
A-GPS needs a wireless data connection to acquire the assistant data that may cause extra fees. Are you sure to turn on the A-GPS?
Use GPS assistance data (EPO) to speed up GPS positioning.
GPS can speed up the fixed time of location with assistant data via wireless data connection
Use assistant data to speed up the fixed time of location with GPS

"\u0009 A-GPS (Assisted-GPS) is the system that can improve the startup performance and time-to-first-fix (TTFF) of GPS satellites. \u0009 An A-GPS capable device can connect to location servers to acquire the assist data through mobile network data connection. \u0009 Notice that the data traffic may cause extra fees under network roaming conditions. Please contact with your operators for the details."

"\u0009EPO (Extended Prediction Orbit) is one of MediaTek's innovative proprietary off-line server based A-GPS technology. \u0009It supports up to 30 days satellite orbit prediction, which can be used to greatly enhance user experience by improving GPS Time To First Fix (TTFF)."
Use A-GPS both under home and roaming network
Use A-GPS only under home network
Please turn on data connection before using A-GPS
A-GPS needs to access the mobile network via data connections
If the network under roaming condition, A-GPS data traffic may cause extra roaming fees.
Please turn on data connection before downloading EPO data.
Downloading EPO data in roaming state may cause extra fees. Are you sure to continue?

"It will take at most 1 minute to obtain GPS fix. Besides, GPS may fail to provide time due to weak environmental signal.
Are you sure to use GPS provided time?"

"To use GPS provided time, you must enable GPS first. It then take at most 1 minute to obtain GPS fix. Besides, GPS may fail to provide time due to weak environmental signal.
Are you sure to enable GPS now and wait for GPS provided time?"

3G service is not available with this selected SIM. This may load data slower. You can change the 3G service setting under Settings > SIM management.

"1, After enabling Auto-push service, you can receive pushed messages. 2 After received pushed messages, incur local application running and produce data traffic. See the fees mobile operators have announced the charges. 3 Need to open the corresponding SIM card data connectivity in order to receive push messages. 4 The usual auto-push services include email notification, device management, service indication, service loading and provisioning push."
You must enable data roaming for this SIM first which may incur significant roaming charges! Are you sure to enable data roaming and select this SIM?

3G service is not available with this selected SIM. This may load data slower. You can change the 3G service setting under Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks. Are you sure to select this SIM?
3G service is not available with this selected SIM. This may load data slower. You can change the 3G service setting under Settings > SIM management. Are you sure to select this SIM?

You must enable data roaming for this SIM first which may incur significant roaming charges! Besides, 3G service is not available with this SIM. This may load data slower. You must enable data roaming for this SIM first which may incur significant roaming charges! Besides, 3G service is not available with this SIM. This may load data slower. You can change it under Settings > SIM management. Are you sure to enable data roaming and select this SIM?

Require a numeric PIN or password to decrypt your phone each time you power it on

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your phone, you need to type a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on. You can't decrypt your phone except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Caution: Encryption can cause power-off alarm fail to function.
Encryption takes several minutes or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data."
Charge your battery and try again.
Plug in your charger and try again.
No lock screen PIN or password
You need to set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
"The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you'll lose data. Encryption takes several minutes or more, during which the phone will restart several times."
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.

"Encryption was interrupted and can't complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts, and more.
Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can: "
"Pan: Drag two or more fingers across the screen. "
Adjust zoom level: Pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."

"When this feature is turned on, you can quickly enable accessibility features in two steps:
Step 1: Press and hold the power button until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.
Step 2: Touch and hold two fingers until you hear audio confirmation.
If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked."
Update screen magnification on app transitions

"Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the phone to the web. A Google Account works this way.

"You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customize with their own apps, wallpaper, and so on. Users can also adjust tablet settings like WLAN that affect everyone.
After you create a new user, that person needs to go through a setup process.
Any user can accept updated app permissions on behalf of all other users."

"1，USB mass storage：phone as a U disk for file operation.
2，MTP：Phone as a U disk for file operation，operate file in phone at the same time. When computer OS is XP or below , it needs to install driver.
3，PTP：Use camera software to translate photos.When computer OS is XP or below , it needs to install driver.
4，USB debug：When connected , manage phone in computer with software such as LeHelper , 91 Helper and so on.
5，USB tethering：When connected , the computer can access internet through your phone. the U disk can not be installed when connecting."
Select the types of emergency alerts to display.

Introduction：Record connected WLAN network, and later if you use 3G/2G GPRS data service in its coverage area, you will be remined to connect to this WLAN network or it will connect to this network automatically.
